articles.title: DMart sees muted profit in Q2 even as growth returns to older stores | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: Avenue Supermarts Ltd, which runs the DMart retail chain, recorded a 15.4% year-on-year rise in consolidated net revenue to ₹16,676.3 crore in the July-September quarter, driven by steady growth in its older stores and continued expansion across key cities. Consolidated net profit rose a muted 3.8% to ₹684.85 crore in the second quarter of FY26, amid high employee and finance costs. DMart's staff expenses surged 32% year-on-year to ₹376.83 crore in the second quarter of FY26, reflecting a persistent challenge for the retailer.

articles.title: Biggest joke in history: Uddhav Thackeray blasts Maharashtra flood relief package
articles.excerpt: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday launched a scathing attack on the Maharashtra government's recently announced Rs 31,628 crore relief package for flood-hit farmers, terming it the "biggest joke in history" and demanding an immediate, complete loan waiver. Speaking at a rally in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, Thackeray warned that farmers would "take to the streets" if the Devendra Fadnavis-led Mahayuti government failed to declare a "complete loan waiver". The call for a complete waiver was echoed by other opposition parties, who have uniformly criticised the package as "hollow" and "too meagre".

articles.title: Watch: Rare tornado whirls over Odisha's Chilika Lake, sends tourists scrambling

The rare phenomenon, resembling a waterspout or massive whirlwind, was spotted in the southwestern direction of Goddess Kalijai Temple, the presiding deity of Chilika lake.

articles.title: Ukraine Claims Strike on Oil Refinery Complex in Russia’s Ufa | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- Ukraine’s forces struck a crude oil processing unit at a Bashneft refinery in Ufa, Bashkortostan, with drones early Saturday, according to a person familiar with the matter. The giant complex, part of the Rosneft energy group, is located about 1,750 kilometers (1,090 miles) from Kyiv and about 1,200 km east of Moscow. It was the third strike this year at that location, according to the person, who wasn’t authorized to speak publicly..

It was the third strike this year at that location, according to the person, who wasn’t authorized to speak publicly.

articles.title: Over 60 killed as drone strike hits displacement shelter in western Sudan
articles.excerpt: At least 60 people were killed in a drone strike on a shelter housing displaced civilians in Al-Fashir, western Sudan, amid the country’s ongoing and devastating civil war, a rights group said on Saturday. According to the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, a three-day surge in fighting has left several civilians dead as drone and artillery strikes, primarily carried out by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF), hit the Abu Shouk and Daraja Oula neighbourhoods as well as the Al-Fashir displaced persons camp. The UN rights office reported that the drones also struck one of the last functioning hospitals in the region and a nearby mosque where civilians had sought refuge..

articles.title: S-CORD holds second meeting to strengthen Indias fight against smuggling | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: New Delhi [India], October 11 (ANI): The second meeting of the National Anti-Smuggling Coordination Centre (S-CORD) was held on October 10, 2025, at the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) Headquarters. The meeting brought together representatives from 21 key agencies across India. The Central Board of Indirect Taxes & Customs (CBIC) on X said, "The second meeting of the National Anti-Smuggling Coordination Centre (S-CORD) was held on October 10, 2025, at the DRI Headquarters." Officials from major border guarding forces such as Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB), Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP), Border Security Force (BSF), Assam Rifles (AR), Central Industrial Security Force (CISF), Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF), and the Indian Coast Guard attended the session.

articles.title: Uttarakhand claims 23 crore tourists visited in 3 years, 22 times its population
articles.excerpt: The Uttarakhand government has claimed a record surge in tourism over the last three years. According to figures released by the Chief Minister’s Office, as many as 23.46 crore tourists visited the hill state between 2022-23 and 2024-25, a number that is 22 times higher than the state’s population. The government said the unprecedented growth in tourist footfall is not merely the result of promotion and publicity, but the outcome of “solid planning and policy reforms.” The Tourism Department said that under the leadership of Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami, the state has witnessed remarkable growth in religious, spiritual, and adventure tourism..

articles.title: Trinamool vs Trinamool: Woman panchayat chief thrashed by rival, clothes torn
articles.excerpt: A woman panchayat chief in West Bengal was allegedly assaulted, her clothes ripped off, and her face smeared with ink as two factions of the Trinamool Congress clashed during a panchayat meeting. The incident, in which panchayat chief Deepali Singh was brutally thrashed, happened during a meeting of the Trinamool-led Chhangual panchayat in Kharagpur block II. A video of the TMC vs TMC free-for-all has gone viral, inviting sneers from the opposition BJP ahead of crucial Assembly elections next year.

articles.title: Singapore to act on India’s request in Zubeen Garg case; post-mortem report awaited
articles.excerpt: The investigation into the mysterious death of legendary Assamese singer Zubeen Garg has entered a critical phase, with Singapore authorities confirming India’s request for legal assistance in the case. According to MP Gupta, Special DGP, Assam, who heads the Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the case, the Attorney-General’s Office of Singapore will now decide on India’s request. The confirmation marks a breakthrough for investigators seeking cooperation on several leads tied to Garg’s final days in Singapore.advertisementOVERSEAS LINKS UNDER SCRUTINYGupta said that the SIT has intensified its probe into the overseas links connected to the case.

articles.title: Are Nobel Laureates Abhijit Banerjee and Esther Duflo leaving US for Switzerland? Here's all we know
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like Esther Duflo and Abhijit Banerjee, who are among the top development economists worldwide, will join the University of Zurich's (UZH) Faculty of Business, Economics, and Informatics in July 2026. At the moment, they are both instructors at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). The pair shared the 2019 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences with Michael Kremer in recognition of their “experimental approach to alleviating global poverty.” In July 2026, Nobel laureates Banerjee and Duflo will depart the United States to move to the University of Zurich.

articles.title: 2 Army commandos die amid severe weather during anti-terror op in J&K's Anantnag
articles.excerpt: Two Army para-commandos lost their lives during an anti-terror operation in Jammu and Kashmir’s Anantnag district after being caught in severe weather conditions, officials said on Friday. The bodies of Lance Havildar Palash Ghosh and Lance Naik Sujay Ghosh, both from the Army’s elite para unit, were recovered from the Kishtwar Range of Kokernag after days of intensive search and rescue operations. The soldiers had gone missing on Tuesday while conducting a combing operation in the Ahlan Gadole area, following inputs about the presence of terrorists.

articles.title: Mahindra Lifespaces acquires land in Pune for  ₹3,500 crore development | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: Mahindra Lifespace Developers has announced the acquisition of 13.46 acres of land in the Nande-Mahalunge area of Pune, with an estimated development potential of approximately ₹3500 crore, it said in a stock exchange filing on Friday. The Nande-Mahalunge area is one of Pune’s most promising micro-markets, with a growing demand for high-quality, future-ready homes with modern amenities, said Vimalendra Singh, Chief Business Officer – Residential, Mahindra Lifespace Developers. The location offers excellent connectivity through the proposed PMRDA Town Planning Scheme and the upcoming Inner Ring Road, enhancing access to the IT and BFSI hubs of Hinjewadi and Baner-Balewadi, he added.

articles.title: High Drama in Lucknow: Akhilesh Yadav Blocked, SP Workers Protest at JPNAIC
articles.excerpt: This special report focuses on the extradition of fugitives Vijay Mallya and Nirav Modi from the United Kingdom, a key issue during UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's visit to India for talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The UK's legal system, while not intentionally protecting fugitives, prioritises human rights and due process, which allows extradition to be contested at multiple levels. In a case highlighting these delays, the report notes, 'a UK court had approved extradition [for Vijay Mallya] way back in 2019...and yet his extradition has been mysteriously stuck due to what's referred to as "confidential legal matters".' The analysis explores how both Mallya and Modi have used the UK's Extradition Act of 2003, citing concerns over prison conditions and mental health, to prolong their legal battles, despite India's persistent efforts and the existence of a 1992 extradition treaty..

articles.excerpt: Tollywood actor Srikanth Iyengar stirred a controversy after a video went viral showing him making alleged derogatory remarks about Mahatma Gandhi. In the viral clip, Iyengar said that calling Gandhi the "Father of the Nation" was an "insult to all". articles.title: Trump’s Dealmaking Diplomacy Grows Fragile as China Fires Back
articles.excerpt: President Donald Trump Photographer: Shawn Thew/EPA/Bloomberg President Donald Trump’s preference to cut one-to-one deals with allies and adversaries has been the hallmark of his self-proclaimed dealmaking magic, but with the China trade truce seemingly teetering on collapse, the fragility of such an approach has been laid bare. China’s Ministry of Commerce late Wednesday night New York time unveiled broad new export controls of rare earths and other critical materials that are key to US defense and technologies applications. The news sparked shock across those specific groups, but wasn’t met with similar reaction across broader markets..

articles.title: Trump's Shutdown Legacy: How US Political Chaos Once Threatened the Indian Economy
articles.excerpt: This special report focuses on the extradition of fugitives Vijay Mallya and Nirav Modi from the United Kingdom, a key issue during UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's visit to India for talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The UK's legal system, while not intentionally protecting fugitives, prioritises human rights and due process, which allows extradition to be contested at multiple levels. In a case highlighting these delays, the report notes, 'a UK court had approved extradition [for Vijay Mallya] way back in 2019...and yet his extradition has been mysteriously stuck due to what's referred to as "confidential legal matters".' The analysis explores how both Mallya and Modi have used the UK's Extradition Act of 2003, citing concerns over prison conditions and mental health, to prolong their legal battles, despite India's persistent efforts and the existence of a 1992 extradition treaty..

articles.title: Tata Empire Shaken: Top Trustees In Open Revolt, Govt Intervention Sought Explainer
articles.excerpt: This special report delves into the cultural phenomenon of Rishab Shetty's film 'Kantara', which has cast a spotlight on the ancient Tulu traditions of coastal Karnataka. The narrative explores the deep-rooted practices of Bhuta Kola, the worship of local spirits, and the significance of the deities Panjurli and its companion, Guliga. The film showcases Bhuta Kola, which 'literally means spirit play in Tulu and it's a ritualistic performance honoring Bhutas, local spirits or deities who are believed to be protectors of the land, villages and families.' The report explains the mythology behind Panjurli, a boar spirit often associated with Lord Vishnu's Varaha avatar, seen as a powerful protector of agriculture and villages.

articles.title: OpenAI accused of using intimidation tactics to erode California's proposed AI safety law: Here's what we know | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: A small non-profit has accused Sam Altman-led OpenAI of intimidation tactics to dilute California's proposed AI safety law, known in short as SB 53. The accusation came in a now viral post on social media platform X (formerly Twitter), by 29-year-old Nathan Calvin, legal counsel for Encode, who alleged that OpenAI is working to undermine the California Transparency in Frontier Artificial Intelligence Act (SB 53), which it is under debate by lawmakers. In his own lengthy post addressing the issue, OpenAI's chief strategy officer Jason Kwon, dismissed the allegations made by Calvin, and called Encode's funding under question — hinting that the public accusation was funded by Elon Musk..

articles.title: Ashwini Vaishnaw Unveils Yatri Suvidha Kendra At NDLS Ahead Of Festival Rush
articles.excerpt: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw inaugurated a new Yatri Suvidha Kendra at NDLS to assist passengers during the upcoming festival rush, ensuring smoother travel and better facilities. Trending Photos The state-of-the-art Yatri Suvidha Kendra at New Delhi Railway Station (NDLS) will provide comfort to passengers during festival season as there is a surge in the passenger volume, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Saturday. He inspected the newly-constructed permanent holding area which has been designed to accommodate approximately 7,000 passengers at any given time, enhancing pre-boarding comfort and flow.

articles.title: Philippines Shaken By Double Earthquake; Tsunami Warning Issued
articles.excerpt: Twin earthquakes hit the Philippines, killing seven and triggering a tsunami warning as rescue operations begin in affected areas. Trending Photos A powerful magnitude 7.4 earthquake struck off the southern coast of the Philippines on Friday, killing at least six people. A second strong aftershock measuring 6.9 hit later the same day, claiming at least one more life and prompting tsunami warnings across the region, Al Jazeera reported, citing a local authorities statement.

articles.title: Silver Crosses Rs 1.64 Lakh Level, Gold Surges By Over Rs 2,000 This Week
articles.excerpt: According to the Indian Bullion And Jewellers Association (IBJA), silver price surged by Rs 4,950 on Friday to end at Rs 1,64,500 per kg, from the previous day's price of Rs 1,59,550 per kg. In contrast, the 24-carat gold rate fell Rs 1,104 to Rs 1,21,525 per 10 grams from its all-time high of Rs 1,22,629 on Thursday. Trending Photos New Delhi: The Indian bullion market remained bullish this week, continuing the past week's momentum.

Interestingly, the pilot introduces agentic AI, artificial intelligence that can perform tasks with minimal human help.

articles.title: Tribunal takes up Akshay Kumar’s plea against edtech firm over Rs 4 crore due
articles.excerpt: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) is considering actor Akshay Kumar’s plea against online edtech company Cue Learn Private Ltd over the company’s alleged failure to pay over Rs 4 crore under an endorsement agreement. NCLAT’s decision came after the lower body dismissed the actor’s plea, citing that it does not have the jurisdiction to resolve it. articles.title: Quota for OBC in local body polls should be within 'triple test' framework set by SC: Telangana HC
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like Hyderabad, Oct 11 (PTI) The Telangana High Court has affirmed that the 50 per cent reservation ceiling set by the Supreme Court applies to local body polls, and any quota increase for OBCs should be within the framework of the "triple test". The Supreme Court's triple test is a framework for providing reservations for Other Backward Classes (OBCs) in local body elections, requiring states to form a commission to collect data, specify the reservation proportion based on the commission's findings, and ensure the total reservation for SCs, STs, and OBCs does not exceed 50 per cent of the total seats..

articles.title: Trump is ‘obsessed’ with seeming pro-worker – but his actions suggest otherwise
articles.excerpt: Agriculture and other sectors are suffering under the administration’s policies, adding up to a grim outlook Unpaid forced leave and mass firings are hardly the first things to spring to mind as hallmarks of a golden age of the American worker. Yet these were the possibilities floated by Donald Trump this week as he addressed a government shutdown that began on 1 October and is showing no imminent sign of ending as Democrats and Republicans attempt to stare each other down in a dispute over funding priorities. As reports emerged of a White House memorandum suggesting that furloughed federal workers might not receive back pay, Trump – who ostentatiously posed as the champion of American workers during last year’s presidential election campaign – was quick to twist the knife.

articles.title: Government expands procurement to include three pulses
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like New Delhi: The Centre has readied a policy to expand its procurement programme for farm produce, planning to purchase entire quantities of three key pulses varieties without any cap, in line with a similar policy for cereals, the top bureaucrat in the agriculture ministry said on Friday. The move aims at nudging farmers away from growing surplus food grains, which itself is the result of unlimited federal purchases of cereals at minimum support prices, or MSPs, which offer growers an assured market. articles.excerpt: New Delhi, Oct 11 (PTI) Private equity investments in Indian real estate dropped 15 per cent in July-September to USD 819 million amid global uncertainties, according to property consultant Anarock. articles.title: Killer Cough Syrup: Delhi Bans Coldrif After Over 20 Child Deaths in MP
articles.excerpt: This special report focuses on the significant regulatory action taken in Chhattisgarh, where the state's Drug Controller has banned 39 medicines, including cough and cold syrups, from the Tamil Nadu-based CSUN Pharmaceutical. Sumi Rajappan reports that authorities 'have taken strict action against Tamil Nadu based CSUN Pharmaceuticals following the quality concerns that have arised in the states of Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan.' The market supply of these products has been immediately stopped pending laboratory results from over 100 samples that have been collected for testing from CSUN and other companies. The Chhattisgarh Medical Services Corporation (CGMSC) has also clarified that two other firms, Kesan Pharma and Sonata Pharma, have never supplied medicines to the state government.

articles.title: A Great Year for US Stocks? Not Compared to Rest of the World
articles.excerpt: Check a ranking of the best-performing equity indexes this year and the US doesn’t crack the Top 10. You won’t find it in the Top 25, either. Double that, and the S&P 500 is still absent.
articles.content_snippet: Check a ranking of the best-performing equity indexes this year and the US doesn’t crack the Top 10. You won’t find it in the Top 25, either. Double that, and the S&P 500 is still absent. The tally needs to unfurl all the way to 66 before the world’s most valuable equity index shows up — leaving it way behind Greece’s Athex and even Israel’s TA-35. It’s one of the worst relative performances since the global financial crisis for the US benchmark.

articles.title: Revealed: Labour-run council using legal loophole to serve families with no-fault evictions
articles.excerpt: Exclusive: London council created an arm’s-length body to manage some of its housing stock A Labour-run council is using a legal loophole to issue dozens of families with no-fault evictions, despite Keir Starmer’s manifesto pledge to outlaw the practice. Scrapping no-fault evictions “immediately” was one of Labour’s main manifesto pledges before its 2024 election win, but more than a year on, the party’s flagship renters’ rights bill has not been made law. Local authorities cannot normally carry out no-fault evictions – known officially as section 21 evictions – as they apply to tenancies issued by private landlords.

articles.title: Widow of man conned out of pension savings to lose half the compensation to tax
articles.excerpt: Robert Dewar’s widow, Susan, is a leading campaigner over multimillion-pound Norton Motorcycles fraud The family of a deceased man, who was conned out of his retirement savings after investing in the Norton Motorcycles pension scam, is to lose almost half the subsequent compensation award because of a little-known tax rule. A long-running battle to win an award from the Fraud Compensation Fund (FCF) meant that Robert Dewar’s pension was not reimbursed until 2024, five years after his death at the age of 64. Dewar’s widow, Susan, had been expecting to inherit his pension tax free, as is typically the case when a spouse dies before the age of 75.
